title: Propaganda: Persuasion at Scale
description: A quick win: understand Propaganda: Persuasion at Scale.

hook.text: In 1917, a poster of Uncle Sam pointing at you convinced millions of Americans to enlist for war.

buildup.text: Propaganda targets masses using emotion, repetition, and symbols to bypass rational thinking.

discovery.text: Edward Bernays, Freud's nephew, invented modern PR. He called propaganda by a friendlier name.

twist.text: Bernays convinced women to smoke by framing cigarettes as 'torches of freedom.' Marketing met manipulation.

climax.text: The techniques haven't changed â€” only the medium has. Posters became algorithms.

punchline.text: Propaganda never disappeared. It just got a rebrand.

quiz.question: What did Edward Bernays rebrand propaganda as?
